title: Data Analysis Fundamentals
description: Test your knowledge of data analysis concepts, statistics, and data manipulation.

questions.question: What is data science?
options: Extracting insights and knowledge from data using scientific methods
questions.correctAnswer: Extracting insights and knowledge from data using scientific methods
questions.explanation: Data science combines statistics, programming, and domain expertise to extract meaningful insights from data.

questions.question: What is the median in a dataset?
options: The middle value when data is sorted
The difference between max and min
questions.correctAnswer: The middle value when data is sorted
questions.explanation: The median is the middle value in a sorted dataset, less affected by outliers than the mean.

questions.question: What does standard deviation measure?
options: The spread or variability of the data
questions.correctAnswer: The spread or variability of the data
questions.explanation: Standard deviation measures how spread out the values are from the mean of the dataset.

questions.question: What does correlation measure?
questions.explanation: Correlation measures how strongly two variables are related to each other.

questions.question: What is pandas used for in Python?
questions.explanation: Pandas is a Python library for data manipulation and analysis, providing data structures like DataFrame.

questions.question: What is data cleaning?
options: Removing all data from a dataset
Preparing data for analysis by handling missing values and errors
questions.correctAnswer: Preparing data for analysis by handling missing values and errors
questions.explanation: Data cleaning involves identifying and correcting errors, handling missing values, and preparing data for analysis.

questions.question: What is a normal distribution?
options: A distribution that is always skewed
questions.explanation: A normal distribution is symmetric around the mean, with most values clustering around the center.

questions.question: What is hypothesis testing used for?
options: Testing claims about populations using sample data
questions.correctAnswer: Testing claims about populations using sample data
questions.explanation: Hypothesis testing is a statistical method to determine if there's enough evidence to reject a null hypothesis.

title: Data Visualization & Machine Learning
description: Explore data visualization techniques and machine learning fundamentals.

questions.question: What is matplotlib used for?
options: Creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations
questions.correctAnswer: Creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations
questions.explanation: Matplotlib is a Python library for creating various types of plots and charts for data visualization.

questions.question: What is seaborn built on top of?
questions.explanation: Seaborn is built on top of matplotlib and provides a high-level interface for statistical graphics.

questions.question: What type of plot shows the relationship between two continuous variables?
questions.explanation: Scatter plots display the relationship between two continuous variables, showing correlation patterns.

questions.question: Why do we split data into training and testing sets?
options: To evaluate model performance on unseen data
questions.correctAnswer: To evaluate model performance on unseen data
questions.explanation: Train-test split allows us to train the model on one portion of data and evaluate its performance on unseen data.

questions.question: What is a sign of overfitting in a model?
options: High training accuracy, low testing accuracy
Low training accuracy, high testing accuracy
Both accuracies are similar and high
Both accuracies are similar and low
questions.correctAnswer: High training accuracy, low testing accuracy
questions.explanation: Overfitting occurs when a model performs well on training data but poorly on new, unseen data.

questions.question: When should you apply feature scaling?
options: When features have different scales and algorithm is distance-based
questions.correctAnswer: When features have different scales and algorithm is distance-based
questions.explanation: Feature scaling is important for algorithms like KNN, SVM, and neural networks where distance calculations matter.

questions.question: What does cross-validation help with?
questions.explanation: Cross-validation helps assess model performance reliably, reduces overfitting, and provides better estimates than single train-test split.

questions.question: In a confusion matrix, what does 'precision' measure?
options: Proportion of true positives among all positive predictions
Proportion of true positives among all actual positives
Proportion of negative predictions that are correct
questions.correctAnswer: Proportion of true positives among all positive predictions
questions.explanation: Precision measures the accuracy of positive predictions, showing how many predicted positives are actually positive.
